attributes.action: Urgently Recommend a Remedial Judicial Appointments Quota System ; which would fairly ensure that at least one UK Supreme Court Judge (out of 12) actually hails from the Black (or Asian) British Community.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
As at the current date of creation of this particular Online Petition (in Early March 2010) , the UK still has No Black (or Asian) Supreme Court Judges , No Black (or Asian) Appeal Court Judges and No Black (or Asian) Judicial Division Heads. 


We therefore humbly petition the Rt Hon UK Prime Minister to (at least) Initially Attempt to Boldly Tackle the Glaring Problem ; most preferably by urgently recommending a Remedial Judicial Appointments Quota System , which would fairly (and permanently) ensure that at least one UK Supreme Court Judge (out of 12) actually hails from the Black (or Asian) British Community.


The very same (one in 12) Remedial Quota Formula should also judiciously apply to the Statutory Appointment of UK Appellate Judges and UK Judicial Division Heads.
